intro: Ionoxalis schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiedea oxalis, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. Ionoxalis schiedeana is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
